schema.description: The ID of the resource.
The ID of the new resource group.
The resource type. Set the value to backupplan.
A client token to ensure that the request is idempotent. This prevents the same request from being submitted multiple times.
The ID of the region where the instance resides.

Data.description:
Indicates whether the resource group was changed. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

ErrCode.description: The error code returned if the call fails.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

ErrMessage.description: The error message returned if the call fails.

Code.description: The status code of the API.

Message.example: The resource group is forbidden to operate

The ID of the PolarDB instance.

CreateAdvancedPolicy.title: CreateAdvancedPolicy
CreateAdvancedPolicy.summary: Enables an advanced backup policy for a PolarDB instance.
CreateAdvancedPolicy.description:
### [](#)Supported database engines

PolarDB for MySQL

>  This API operation is available only to specific customers. If you want to call this API operation, join the Database Backup (DBS) DingTalk group (ID 35585947) for customer consultation to request permissions.

schema.description: The ID of the region where the instance resides. You can call the [DescribeDBInstanceAttribute](~~26231~~) operation for an RDS instance or the [DescribeDBClusterAttribute](~~2319132~~) operation for a PolarDB cluster to query the region ID.
The instance ID.

The type of the download task. Valid values:

- **full**: downloads a full backup set.

- **pitr**: downloads data at a specific point in time.

The ID of the backup set. You can call the [DescribeBackups](~~26273~~) operation for an RDS instance or the [DescribeBackups](~~2319224~~) operation for a PolarDB cluster to query this parameter.

> This parameter is required when BakSetType is set to full.

The point in time to which you want to download data. Specify a UNIX timestamp of the long data type. Unit: milliseconds.

> This parameter is required when BakSetType is set to pitr.

The size of the full backup set. You can call the [DescribeBackups](~~26273~~) operation for an RDS instance or the [DescribeBackups](~~2319224~~) operation for a PolarDB cluster to query the size. Unit: bytes.

The format to which you want to convert the downloaded data. Valid values:

- **CSV**

- **SQL**

- **Parquet**

> This parameter is required.

The destination type for the download. Valid values:

- **OSS**

- **URL**

The name of the OSS bucket.

- This parameter is required when TargetType is set to OSS.

- Make sure that your account has the **AliyunDBSDefaultRole** permission. For more information about how to grant permissions, see [Grant permissions to a RAM role](~~26307~~). You can also go to the console to grant permissions as prompted.

The destination path to which the data is downloaded.

> This parameter is required when TargetType is set to OSS.

The region where the OSS bucket resides.

> This parameter is required when TargetType is set to OSS.
This field is required only for MongoDB instances. It indicates whether the primary key type in the database and table is unique. Valid values: true and false.

This field is required only for MongoDB instances. It indicates whether the current instance is a sharded cluster. If the instance is a sharded cluster, set the value to true. Otherwise, set the value to false.
This field is required only for MongoDB instances. It specifies the name of the authentication database. The default value is admin.
Indicates whether the zstd compression algorithm is used for the compressed package. The default value is false.
This field is required only for MongoDB sharded clusters. It specifies the ID of the sharded cluster.
The return values.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

BakSetId.description: The ID of the full backup set.

DownloadStatus.description:
The status of the download task. Valid values:

- initializing: The task is being initialized.

- queueing: The task is in a queue.

- running: The task is running.

- failed: The task failed.

- finished: The task is complete.

- expired: The task has expired.

> A task whose destination is a URL expires three days after it is complete.

Progress.description:
The number of downloaded tables/The total number of tables.

> If the task is in the preparation stage, 0/0 is returned.

BackupSetTime.description: The point in time of the point-in-time download task. The value is a UNIX timestamp.

TargetPath.description:
The destination path for the download.

> This parameter is returned when TargetType is set to **OSS**.

DbList.description: If the download task is for specific databases and tables, this field returns information about these databases and tables.

ExportDataSize.description: The volume of exported data. Unit: bytes.

ImportDataSize.description: The volume of processed data. Unit: bytes.

GmtCreate.description: The time when the task was created. The value is a UNIX timestamp.

TaskId.description: The ID of the download task.

Format.description: The format to which the data is converted.

TargetType.description: The destination type for the download.

200.errorMessage: Job already submit in recent days, please check it.
200.description: Job already submit in recent days, please check it.

200.errorMessage: There can be only one running or failed task for the instance.
200.description: The current instance can only have one running/failed task at the same time.

200.errorMessage: OSS is forbidden to access. Please check your OSS bucket.
200.description: OSS is forbidden to access. Please check your OSS bucket.

200.errorMessage: Unsupported bucket storage. Please make sure that your OSS bucket's storgae type is standard.
200.description: Unsupported bucket storage. Please make sure that your OSS bucket's storgae type is standard.

CreateDownload.title: CreateDownload
CreateDownload.description:
### Applicable engines

- RDS MySQL (with cloud disks)

- RDS PostgreSQL

- PolarDB for MySQL

- MongoDB

### Related documents

For eligible instances, you can create an Advanced Download task for a point in time or a specific backup set. You can download the data to a URL or write it directly to your Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket for data analytics and offline archiving.

- [Download an RDS MySQL backup](~~98819~~)

- [Download an RDS PostgreSQL backup](~~96774~~)

- [Download a PolarDB for MySQL backup](~~2627635~~)

- [Download a MongoDB backup](~~55011~~)

schema.description:
The ID of the backup plan.

> If your instance is an ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instance, use the [auto-add data source](~~193091~~) feature to add the RDS instance to DBS and obtain the backup plan ID.
The ID of the sandbox instance.

The zone ID of the destination sandbox instance. The zone must be supported by PrivateLink. Call the [DescribeZones](~~469326~~) operation to query the list of zones in a specific region.

> Before using the sandbox feature, enable [PrivateLink](~~459882~~). Call the [OpenPrivateLinkService](~~469322~~) operation to enable PrivateLink.

Data.example: operation forbidden due to sandbox is creating.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request is successful.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

Message.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

DeleteSandboxInstance.title: DeleteSandboxInstance
DeleteSandboxInstance.description: This operation is only available for the 2021-01-01 version of the DBS API.
DeleteSandboxInstance.extraInfo:
|Error code|Error message|Description|
|---|---|---|
|Operation.DeniedByJobStatus|operation forbidden due to sandbox is creating|The error message returned because the sandbox instance is being created and cannot be released. Release the sandbox instance when it is running.|

DescribeBackupDataList.summary: Queries the details of backups for a PolarDB for MySQL cluster.

schema.description: The ID of the PolarDB cluster.
The region where the backup set is located.
The backup scenario. This parameter supports only **LEVEL\_1**, which indicates a level-1 backup in the region where the instance resides.
The start of the time range to query. Specify the time in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time must be in UTC.
The end of the time range to query. The end time must be later than the start time. Specify the time in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time must be in UTC.

The status of the backup set. Valid values:

- **OK**: The backup is successful.

- **ERROR**: The backup failed.
The ID of the backup set.

The backup method. Valid values:

- **Physical**: physical backup

- **Logical**: logical backup

- **Snapshot**: snapshot backup

The backup mode. Valid values:

- **Automated**: automatic backup

- **Manual**: manual backup

The backup type. Valid values:

- **FullBackup**: full backup

- **IncrementBackup**: incremental backup

The backup scope. Valid values:

- **DBInstance**: instance backup

- **DBTable**: database and table backup
The number of entries to return on each page. The default value is 20.
The page number. The value must be an integer that is greater than 0 and does not exceed the maximum value of the integer data type. The default value is 1.

Specifies whether the instance is deleted. Valid values:

- **true**: The instance is deleted.

- **false**: The instance is not deleted. This is the default value.
The original region of the instance.
This parameter is reserved and does not need to be specified.
The details of the returned parameters.

BackupId.description: The ID of the backup set.

BackupName.description: The name of the backup set.

BackupMode.description:
The backup mode. Valid values:

- **Automated**: automatic backup

- **Manual**: manual backup

BackupType.description:
The backup type. Valid values:

- **FullBackup**: full backup

- **IncrementBackup**: incremental backup

BackupScale.description:
The backup scope. Valid values:

- **DBInstance**: instance backup

- **DBTable**: database and table backup

BackupMethod.description:
The backup method. Valid values:

- **Physical**: physical backup

- **Logical**: logical backup

- **Snapshot**: snapshot backup

BackupSize.description: The size of the backup set in bytes.

BackupStatus.description:
The status of the backup set. Valid values:

- **OK**: The backup is successful.

- **ERROR**: The backup failed.

BackupStartTime.description: The start time of the backup. The time is in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

BackupEndTime.description: The end time of the backup. The time is in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

ConsistentTime.description: The point in time of the consistent snapshot. The value is a UNIX timestamp. Unit: seconds.

BackupLocation.description: The storage path of the backup.

SupportDeletion.description:
Indicates whether the backup set can be deleted. Valid values:

- **0**: The backup set can be deleted.

- **1**: The backup set cannot be deleted.

IsAvail.description:
Indicates whether the backup set is available. Valid values:

- **1**: The backup set is available.

- **0**: The backup set is unavailable.

BackupDownloadURL.description:
The public download URL of the backup set.

> This parameter is returned only when BackupMethod is set to **Physical** (physical backup) or **Logical** (logical backup).

BackupIntranetDownloadURL.description:
The internal download URL of the backup set.

> This parameter is returned only when BackupMethod is set to **Physical** (physical backup) or **Logical** (logical backup).

ExpectExpireType.description:
The expected expiration type of the backup set. Valid values:

- NEVER

- EXPIRED

- DELAY

ExpectExpireTime.description: The expected expiration time of the backup set. The time is in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

PolarSnapshot.description:
The information about the level-2 dump of the PolarDB cluster.

> The PolarSnapshot-related information is returned only after the level-2 dump feature is enabled for the PolarDB cluster in the same region and the level-1 backup is successfully dumped.

DumpSize.description: The size of the dump backup in bytes.

expectExpireType.description:
The expected expiration type of the backup set. Valid values:

- NEVER

- EXPIRED

- DELAY

ExpectExpireTime.description: The expected expiration time of the backup set. The time is in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

TotalElements.description: The total number of backup sets.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

Message.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

DescribeBackupDataList.title: DescribeBackupDataList
DescribeBackupDataList.description:
### Applicable engines

PolarDB for MySQL

> This API operation is available only to specific customers. To use this operation, join the DBS Customer Service DingTalk group (ID: 35585947) to request access.

### Related documents

[Back up a PolarDB for MySQL cluster](~~88172~~)

schema.description: The region where the backup set is located.
The ID of the PolarDB instance.
The response parameters.

Data.description: The details of the backup policy.

PreferredBackupDate.description: The basic backup cycle. This is a 7-digit number. From left to right, each digit represents a day from Monday to Sunday. A value of 1 indicates that a backup is performed, and 0 indicates that no backup is performed.

PreferredBackupWindowBegin.description: The start time of the basic backup window.

BackupRetentionPeriod.description: The retention period for basic backups. If an advanced backup policy is enabled, this is the longest retention period for level-1 backups.

BackupRetentionPolicyOnClusterDeletion.description:
The data retention policy for archived backups of deleted instances. Valid values:

- **NONE**: No backups are retained.

- **LATEST**: The last backup is retained.

- **ALL**: All backups are retained.

HighFrequencyBakInterval.description: The high-frequency backup interval in minutes. For example, a value of 120 means that a backup is performed every two hours.

BackupPriority.description:
The policy for backing up the secondary database. Valid values:

- **1**: The secondary database is preferred.

- **2**: Backup is forced to run on the primary database.

> This parameter applies only to RDS SQL Server instances. For other engines, the return value is **0**.

EnableLogBackup.description:
Specifies whether log backup is enabled. Valid values:

- **1**: Enabled

- **0**: Not enabled

LogBackupRetention.description: The retention period for log backups.

LogBackupLocalRetentionNumber.description: The number of local log files to retain.

LocalLogRetentionSpace.description: The maximum space usage for local logs.

HighSpaceUsageProtection.description:
Specifies whether to forcibly clear logs when the instance space usage exceeds 80% or the remaining space is less than 5 GB. Valid values:

- **Disable**: Do not clear logs.

- **Enable**: Clear logs.

Category.description:
Specifies whether second-level backup is enabled. Valid values:

- **Flash**: Second-level backup is enabled.

- **Standard**: Standard backup.

> This parameter is valid only for MySQL.

IncBackupInterval.description: The interval for high-frequency incremental backups.

EnableIncBackup.description: Specifies whether incremental backup is enabled.

BackupMethod.description:
The backup method. Valid values:

- **Physical**: Physical backup

- **Snapshot**: Snapshot backup

AdvanceLogPolicies.description: The details of the log backup policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the backup policy.

SrcType.description:
The source type of the backup policy. Valid values:

- **db**: Database

- **level1**: Level-1 backup

- **level2**: Level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: Level-2 cross-region backup

SrcRegion.description: The source region of the backup policy.

DestType.description:
The destination type of the backup policy. Valid values:

- **db**: Database

- **level1**: Level-1 backup

- **level2**: Level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: Level-2 cross-region backup

DestRegion.description: The destination region of the backup policy.

LogRetentionType.description:
The retention type for log backups. Valid values:

- **never**: Never expires

- **delay**: Expires after a fixed number of days

LogRetentionValue.description: The retention period for log backups.

AdvanceDataPolicies.description: The details of the data backup policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the advanced policy.

FilterType.description:
The filter type for the advanced policy. Valid values:

- **crontab**: Recurring schedule

- **event**: Event-driven schedule

FilterKey.description:
The schedule type. Valid values:

- **dayOfWeek**: Weekly schedule

- **dayOfMonth**: Monthly schedule

- **dayOfYear**: Yearly schedule

- **backupInterval**: Fixed interval schedule

> This parameter is returned only when FilterType is set to **crontab**.

DumpAction.description:
The dump policy. Valid values:

- **copy**: Copy

- **move**: Dump

RetentionType.description:
The retention period type for the backup set. Valid values:

- **never**: Never expires

- **delay**: Expires after a fixed number of days

RetentionValue.description: The number of days before expiration.

SrcType.description:
The source type of the backup policy. Valid values:

- **db**: Database

- **level1**: Level-1 backup

- **level2**: Level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: Level-2 cross-region backup

SrcRegion.description: The source region of the backup policy.

DestType.description:
The destination type of the backup policy. Valid values:

- **db**: Database

- **level1**: Level-1 backup

- **level2**: Level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: Level-2 cross-region backup

DestRegion.description: The destination region of the backup policy.

BakType.description:
The backup type. Valid values:

- **F**: Full backup

- **L**: Log backup

AutoCreated.description:
Specifies whether the backup policy is automatically generated by the system. Valid values:

- **true**: The policy is generated by the system.

- **false**: The policy is a custom policy.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

Success.description:
Specifies whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

DescribeBackupPolicy.title: DescribeBackupPolicy
DescribeBackupPolicy.summary: Queries the backup policy for a PolarDB instance.
DescribeBackupPolicy.description:
### Applicable engines

PolarDB for MySQL

> This API operation is available only to specific customers. To use this operation, join the DBS Customer Service DingTalk group (ID: 35585947) and request access.

### Related document

[Backup policies for PolarDB for MySQL](~~280422~~)

DescribeCostInfoByDbsInstance.summary: Queries the costs for a DBS instance.

schema.description: The ID of the region where the instance is located. You can find this information in your bill.
The ID of the backup billing instance.

Data.description:

- **commodity**: The commodity.

- **product**: The product.

- **moduleCode**: The billing item.

- **instanceName**: The sandbox instance ID.

- **backupSetId**: The backup set ID.

- **instanceName**: The name of the engine instance.

- **backupPlanId**: The ID of the backup billing instance.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

DescribeDownloadBackupSetStorageInfo.summary: Queries the storage information for downloading a backup set.

schema.description: The ID of the region where the instance resides.

If the download destination is a URL, this parameter specifies the validity period of the link.

- The default validity period of a URL is 2 hours (7,200 seconds).

- You can set the validity period to a value from 5 minutes (300 seconds) to 1 day (86,400 seconds).

- Convert the value to seconds before you pass it. For example, to set the validity period to 5 minutes, pass 300.

The instance ID.

> If you specify **InstanceName**, you must also specify **BackupSetId**.

The ID of the download task.

- If you do not specify **TaskId**, you must specify **BackupSetId** and **InstanceName**.

- To view the task ID, click **Backup and Restoration** for the target instance and go to the **Backup Download** tab.
The ID of the backup set.
This parameter is required only for MongoDB instances. It specifies the name of the sharded cluster.
The returned data.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

ErrMessage.example: Argument: regionCode Must not be empty

Message.example: Argument: regionCode Must not be empty

PublicUrl.description: The public URL to download the backup set.

PrivateUrl.description: The private URL to download the backup set.

ExpirationTime.description:
The validity period of the link.

> The value is a UNIX timestamp.

DescribeDownloadBackupSetStorageInfo.title: DescribeDownloadBackupSetStorageInfo
DescribeDownloadBackupSetStorageInfo.description:
### Applicable engines

- RDS MySQL (cloud disk edition)

- RDS PostgreSQL

- PolarDB for MySQL

- MongoDB

### Related documents

- [Download an RDS MySQL backup](~~98819~~)

- [Download an RDS PostgreSQL backup](~~96774~~)

- [Download a PolarDB for MySQL backup](~~2627635~~)

- [Download a MongoDB backup](~~55011~~)

DescribeDownloadSupport.summary: Queries whether the current instance supports the Advanced Download feature.

schema.description: The region ID of the instance. You can call the [DescribeDBInstanceAttribute](~~26231~~) operation to query the region ID.
The instance ID.
The name of the sharded cluster. This parameter is required only for MongoDB sharded cluster instances.
The response.

Data.description:
Indicates whether the Advanced Download feature is supported. Valid values:

- **true**: The feature is supported.

- **false**: The feature is not supported.

ErrCode.description: The error code returned if the call fails.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

ErrMessage.description: The error message returned if the call fails.
ErrMessage.example: Argument: regionCode Must not be empty

Message.example: Argument: regionCode Must not be empty

DescribeDownloadSupport.responseDemo:
[{"errorExample":"","example":"{

  "RequestId": "F1A186F7-7B34-5C11-A903-EE23876B****",
  "ErrCode": "DBS.ParamIsInValid",
  "Success": "true",

DescribeDownloadSupport.title: DescribeDownloadSupport
DescribeDownloadSupport.description:
### Applicable engines

- RDS MySQL (with cloud disks)

- RDS PostgreSQL

- PolarDB for MySQL

- MongoDB

### Related documents

You can create an Advanced Download task for a point in time or a specific backup set. You can specify a URL as the download destination or write the data directly to your Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket for data analytics and offline archiving.

- [Download an RDS MySQL backup](~~98819~~)

- [Download an RDS PostgreSQL backup](~~96774~~)

- [Download a PolarDB for MySQL backup](~~2627635~~)

- [Download a MongoDB backup](~~55011~~)

DescribeDownloadTask.summary: Queries a list of advanced download tasks for RDS for MySQL, RDS for PostgreSQL, and PolarDB for MySQL instances.

schema.description: The ID of the region where the instance resides. To obtain the region ID, call [DescribeDBInstanceAttribute](~~26231~~).

The instance ID.

> This parameter is required.
The ID of the data source in DBS. The format is: *ds-${Instance ID}\_${Region ID}*.
The ID of the backup set. To obtain the backup set ID, call [DescribeBackups](~~26273~~).

The state of the download task. Valid values:

- **initializing**: The task is being initialized.

- **queueing**: The task is in a queue.

- **running**: The task is running.

- **failed**: The task failed.

- **finished**: The task is successful.

- **expired**: The download has expired.

The type of the download task. Valid values:

- **full**: full backup set download.

- **pitr**: point-in-time recovery download.
The start of the time range to query tasks based on their creation time. This is a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds (ms).
The end of the time range to query tasks based on their creation time. This is a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds (ms).
The number of entries to return on each page.
The page number.

The sorting direction. Valid values:

- **asc**: ascending order.

- **desc**: descending order. This is the default value.
The field used for sorting. The default value is **gmt\_create**, which indicates the creation time.
The name of the sharded cluster. This parameter is required only for MongoDB instances.
The returned parameters.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

PageNumber.description: The page number. It must be greater than 0 and not exceed the maximum value of the integer data type. Default value: 1.

Extra.description: Additional information about the task that is used to back up data to the cloud.

TotalElements.description: The total number of download tasks.

PageSize.description: The number of entries returned per page.

Format.description:
The destination format to which the downloaded data is converted. Valid values:

- **csv**

- **SQL**

- **Parquet**

BakSetId.description: The ID of the full backup set.

DownloadStatus.description:
The state of the download task. Valid values:

- **initializing**: The task is being initialized.

- **queueing**: The task is in a queue.

- **running**: The task is running.

- **failed**: The task failed.

- **finished**: The task is successful.

- **expired**: The download has expired.

ExportDataSize.description: The volume of exported data, in bytes.

ImportDataSize.description: The volume of processed data, in bytes.

BackupSetTime.description: The point in time of the point-in-time download task. This is a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds (ms).

TargetType.description:
The type of the download destination. Valid values:

- **OSS**

- **URL**

TargetPath.description: The destination path of the downloaded data. This parameter is returned when TargetType is set to **OSS**.

Progress.description: The number of exported tables/The total number of tables to be exported.

GmtCreate.description: The time when the task was created. This is a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds.

DescribeDownloadTask.responseDemo:
[{"errorExample":"","example":"{
  "RequestId": "5D285EB9-A443-592D-9F3D-A888FAC3****",
  "ErrCode": "DBS.InternalError",

        }
      ]
    }
  }
}","type":"json"}]
DescribeDownloadTask.title: DescribeDownloadTask
DescribeDownloadTask.description:
### Applicable engines

- ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instances that use cloud disks

- ApsaraDB RDS for PostgreSQL

- PolarDB for MySQL

- MongoDB

### Related documents

- [Download the backup of an ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instance](~~98819~~)

- [Download the backup of an ApsaraDB RDS for PostgreSQL instance](~~96774~~)

- [Download the backup of a PolarDB for MySQL instance](~~2627635~~)

- [Download the backup of a MongoDB instance](~~55011~~)

schema.description:
The ID of the backup plan.

> If your instance is an RDS for MySQL instance, automatically add the RDS instance to DBS to obtain the backup plan ID. For more information, see [Automatically add a data source](~~193091~~).

The ID of the backup set. If you specify this parameter, the operation returns information about the snapshots of only this backup set. If you do not specify this parameter, the operation returns information about the snapshots of all backup sets that are created for the backup plan.

The number of entries per page. Valid values:

- 30 (default)
- 50
- 100
The page number. The value must be greater than 0 and cannot exceed the maximum value of the integer data type. Default value: 1.

Data.description:
The data returned. The value of this parameter is a JSON string. The JSON string contains the following fields:

- **backupSetTime**: The point in time of the snapshot. The time is in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format and is displayed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
- **backupSetId**: The ID of the backup set.
- **backupSetType**: The type of the snapshot. Valid values: **Full** (full backup) and **Inc** (incremental backup).
- **backupPlanId**: The ID of the backup plan.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

Message.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

DescribeSandboxBackupSets.responseDemo:
[{"errorExample":"","example":"{
  "Data": "  \"Data\": {     \"number\": 2,     \"size\": 2,     \"content\": [       {         \"backupSetTime\": \"2021-08-28T23:12:31Z\",         \"backupSetId\": \"Inc_1hxxxx8xxxxxa_20210801064200_mysql-bin.000134\",         \"backupSetType\": \"Inc\",         \"backupPlanId\": \"1hxxxx8xxxxxa\"       },       {         \"backupSetTime\": \"2021-08-28T22:42:28Z\",         \"backupSetId\": \"1hxxxx8xxxxxa_20210829064228\",         \"backupSetType\": \"FULL\",         \"backupPlanId\": \"1hxxxx8xxxxxa\"       }     ],     \"totalElements\": 2   },",
  "RequestId": "4F1888AC-1138-4995-B9FE-D2734F61C058",
  "ErrCode": "Param.NotFound",
  "Success": "true",
  "ErrMessage": "The specified parameter %s value is not valid.",
  "Code": "Param.NotFound",
  "Message": "The specified parameter %s value is not valid."
}","type":"json"}]
DescribeSandboxBackupSets.title: DescribeSandboxBackupSets
DescribeSandboxBackupSets.description: You must enable the sandbox feature for the database instance before you perform this operation. For more information, see [Emergency recovery for an RDS for MySQL instance](~~203154~~) or [Emergency recovery for a self-managed MySQL database (sandbox instance)](~~185577~~). This operation is supported only in DBS API version 2021-01-01.

schema.description:
The ID of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup schedule.

> If your instance is an ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instance, you can [configure automatic access to a data source](~~193091~~) to automatically add the instance to DBS and obtain the ID of the backup schedule.
The ID of the sandbox instance. You can call the [CreateSandboxInstance](~~437252~~) operation to obtain the ID of the sandbox instance.

The number of entries to return on each page. Valid values:

*   30\. This is the default value.
*   50
*   100
The number of the page to return. The value must be an integer that is greater than 0. Default value: 1.

Data.description:
The response parameters.

*   **connectionString**: the connection string of the sandbox instance, in the format of IP address:Port number. This parameter indicates the endpoint of the sandbox instance if the value of the SandboxType parameter is **Sandbox**. This parameter indicates the Network File System (NFS) mount address if the value of the SandboxType parameter is **NFS**.
*   **restoreSeconds**: the time required to create the sandbox instance. Unit: seconds.
*   **restoreTime**: the point in time to which the sandbox instance is restored. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.
*   **instanceId**: the ID of the sandbox instance.
*   **backupSetId**: the ID of the backup set.
*   **createTime**: the point in time when the sandbox instance was created. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.
*   **backupPlanId**: the ID of the backup schedule.
*   **vpcId**: the ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC).
*   **vpcSwitchId**: the ID of the VSwitch.
*   **sandboxSpecification**: the specifications of the sandbox instance.
*   **status**: the status of the sandbox instance. Valid values: **running**, **check_pass**, and **stop**.

ErrCode.description: The error code returned if the request fails.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

ErrMessage.description: The error message returned if the request fails.
ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

Code.description: The error code returned if the request fails.

Message.description: The error message returned if the request fails.
Message.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

DescribeSandboxInstances.responseDemo: [{"type":"json","example":"{ "Data": " { \"number\": 1, \"size\": 1, \"content\": [ { \"connectionString\": \"172.26.178.229:3306\", \"restoreSeconds\": 15, \"restoreTime\": \"2021-08-11T07:26:24Z\", \"instanceId\": \"1jxxxxx9xxxms\", \"backupSetId\": \"1hxxxx8xxxxxa_20210811152624\", \"createTime\": \"2021-08-12T07:40:29Z\", \"backupPlanId\": \"1hxxxx8xxxxxa\", \"vpcId\": \"vpc-bp1dxxxxxjy0xxxxx1xxp\", \"sandboxSpecification\": \"MYSQL_1C_1M_SD\", \"status\": \"running\", \"vpcSwitchId\": \"vsw-bp1bxxxxxumxxxxxwxx2w\" } ], \"totalElements\": 1 }", "RequestId": "4F1888AC-1138-4995-B9FE-D2734F61C058", "ErrCode": "Param.NotFound", "Success": "true", "ErrMessage": "The specified parameter %s value is not valid.", "Code": "Param.NotFound", "Message": "The specified parameter %s value is not valid." }","errorExample":""},{"type":"xml","example":"96A7FD36-9C81-5AA1-A605-C98ED00B0931 2 2 172.27.135.92:3306 64 2021-08-16T13:25:21Z 1jxxxxx9xxxxh BINLOG_1hxxxx8xxxxxa_20210811152624_mysql-bin.000031 2021-08-16T13:43:09Z 1hxxxx8xxxxxa vpc-bp1dxxxxxjy0xxxxx1xxp MYSQL_1C_1M_SD running vsw-bp1bxxxxxumxxxxxwxxx9 172.26.178.229:3306 15 2021-08-11T07:26:24Z 1jxxxxx9xxxms 1hxxxx8xxxxxa_20210811152624 2021-08-12T07:40:29Z 1hxxxx8xxxxxa vpc-bp1dxxxxxjy0xxxxx1xxp MYSQL_1C_1M_SD running vsw-bp1bxxxxxumxxxxxwxx2w 2 Success true Success","errorExample":""}]
DescribeSandboxInstances.title: DescribeSandboxInstances
DescribeSandboxInstances.summary: Queries sandbox instances that are created within an account.
DescribeSandboxInstances.description: This operation is available only in Database Backup (DBS) API of the 2021-01-01 version.
DescribeSandboxInstances.extraInfo:
|Error code|Error message|Description|
|---|---|---|
|DBS.NotExisted|no valid job exist with id|The error message returned because no backup schedule exists for the instance specified by the InstanceId parameter.|

schema.description:
The ID of the backup schedule. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~437215~~) operation to obtain the ID of the backup schedule. If you set this parameter to the backup schedule ID obtained by calling the DescribeBackupPlanList operation, the dbs prefix must be removed. Otherwise, the call fails.

> If your instance is an ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instance, you can [configure automatic access to a data source](~~193091~~) to automatically add the instance to DBS and obtain the ID of the backup schedule.

ErrCode.description: The error code returned if the request fails.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

ErrMessage.description: The error message returned if the request fails.
ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

Code.description: The error code returned if the request fails.

Message.description: The error message returned if the request fails.
Message.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

RecoveryEndTime.description: The end of the time range during which the sandbox instance can be restored. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

BackupPlanId.description: The backup schedule of the sandbox instance.

RecoveryBeginTime.description: The beginning of the time range during which the sandbox instance can be restored. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

DescribeSandboxRecoveryTime.responseDemo: [{"type":"json","example":"{ "RequestId": "4F1888AC-1138-4995-B9FE-D2734F61C058", "ErrCode": "Param.NotFound", "Success": "true", "ErrMessage": "The specified parameter %s value is not valid.", "Code": "Param.NotFound", "Message": "The specified parameter %s value is not valid.", "Data": { "RecoveryEndTime": "2021-08-02T12:01:01Z", "BackupPlanId": "1hxxxx8xxxxxa", "RecoveryBeginTime": "2021-08-01T12:01:01Z" } }","errorExample":""},{"type":"xml","example":"2FC5BFF1-C6AB-594A-9C54-34F9E3A67380 2021-08-30T10:49:18Z 2021-08-23T13:25:12Z 1hxxxx8xxxxxa Success true Success","errorExample":""}]
DescribeSandboxRecoveryTime.title: DescribeSandboxRecoveryTime
DescribeSandboxRecoveryTime.summary: Queries the recoverable time range of a sandbox instance.
DescribeSandboxRecoveryTime.description: Before you call this operation, you must enable the sandbox feature for the database instance. For more information, see [Use the emergency recovery feature of an ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instance](~~203154~~) or [Create a sandbox instance for emergency disaster recovery of a self-managed MySQL database](~~185577~~). This operation is available only in Database Backup (DBS) API of the 2021-01-01 version.

ModifyBackupPolicy.summary: Modifies the backup policy for a PolarDB instance.

schema.description: The region where the backup set is located.
The start time of the backup window.
The ID of the PolarDB instance.

The backup type.

- **Flash**: second-level backup

- **Standard**: standard backup
The details of the data backup policy.

DestType.description:
The destination type of the backup policy. Valid values:

- **db**: database

- **level1**: level-1 backup

- **level2**: level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: level-2 cross-region backup

FilterType.description:
The filter type for the advanced policy. Valid values:

- **crontab**: recurring schedule

- **event**: event-based schedule

ActionType.description:
The operation type. Valid values:

- **CREATE**: adds a policy

- **UPDATE**: modifies a policy

- **DELETE**: deletes a policy

SrcRegion.description: The source region of the backup policy.

SrcType.description:
The source type of the backup policy. Valid values:

- **db**: database

- **level1**: level-1 backup

- **level2**: level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: level-2 cross-region backup

OnlyPreserveOneEachDay.description: Specifies whether to retain only one backup set per day for high-frequency backups that are more than one day old.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the advanced policy. For more information, see [DescribeBackupPolicy](~~2869783~~).

FilterKey.description:
The scheduling type. Valid values:

- **dayOfWeek**: weekly schedule

- **dayOfMonth**: monthly schedule

- **dayOfYear**: yearly schedule

- **backupInterval**: fixed interval schedule

> This parameter is returned only when FilterType is set to **crontab**.

DestRegion.description: The destination region of the backup policy.

RetentionType.description:
The retention period type for the backup set. Valid values:

- **never**: never expires

- **delay**: expires after a fixed number of days

schema.description: The details of the returned parameters.

Data.description: The details of the backup policy.

PreferredBackupWindowBegin.description: The start time of the backup window.

Category.description:
Indicates whether second-level backup is enabled. Returned values:

- **Flash**: Second-level backup is enabled.

- **Standard**: Standard backup is used.

> This parameter is valid only for MySQL.

AdvanceDataPolicies.description: The details of the data backup policy.

BakType.description:
The backup type. Returned values:

- **F**: full backup

- **L**: log backup

FilterKey.description:
The scheduling type. Returned values:

- **dayOfWeek**: weekly schedule

- **dayOfMonth**: monthly schedule

- **dayOfYear**: yearly schedule

- **backupInterval**: fixed interval schedule

> This parameter is returned only when FilterType is set to **crontab**.

DestType.description:
The destination type of the backup policy. Returned values:

- **db**: database

- **level1**: level-1 backup

- **level2**: level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: level-2 cross-region backup

FilterType.description:
The filter type for the advanced policy. Returned values:

- **crontab**: recurring schedule

- **event**: event-based schedule

SrcRegion.description: The source region of the backup policy.

AutoCreated.description:
Indicates whether the backup policy is automatically generated by the system. Returned values:

- **true**: The policy is generated by the system.

- **false**: The policy is a custom policy.

SrcType.description:
The source type of the backup policy. Returned values:

- **db**: database

- **level1**: level-1 backup

- **level2**: level-2 backup

- **level2Cross**: level-2 cross-region backup

OnlyPreserveOneEachDay.description:
Indicates whether to retain only one backup per day.

- **true**: Only one backup is retained per day.

- **false**: All backups are retained.

DumpAction.description:
The details of the dump policy. Returned values:

- **copy**: copy

- **move**: dump

PolicyId.description: The ID of the advanced policy.

DestRegion.description: The destination region of the backup policy.

RetentionType.description:
The retention period type for the backup set. Returned values:

- **never**: never expires

- **delay**: expires after a fixed number of days

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Returned values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

ModifyBackupPolicy.title: ModifyBackupPolicy
ModifyBackupPolicy.description:
### Applicable engines

PolarDB for MySQL

> This API is available only to specific customers. To request access, you can join the DBS customer DingTalk group (ID: 35585947).

RetryDownloadTask.summary: Retries a failed advanced download task.

schema.description: The ID of the region where the instance resides. To query the region ID, call [DescribeDBInstanceAttribute](~~26231~~) for an RDS instance or [DescribeDBClusterAttribute](~~2319132~~) for a PolarDB cluster.
The task ID.
The instance ID.
The name of the sharded cluster. This parameter is required only for MongoDB instances.

Data.description: The details of the download task.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

RetryDownloadTask.title: RetryDownloadTask
RetryDownloadTask.description:

- RDS for MySQL (with cloud disks)

- RDS for PostgreSQL

- PolarDB for MySQL

- MongoDB

### Related documents

- [Download a backup of an RDS for MySQL instance](~~98819~~)

- [Download a backup of an RDS for PostgreSQL instance](~~96774~~)

- [Download a backup of a PolarDB for MySQL cluster](~~2627635~~)

- [Download a backup of a MongoDB instance](~~55011~~)

errorCodes.description: The backup schedule is incorrectly configured.
Failed to query the list of backup schedules.
Failed to modify the backup source endpoint.

errorCodes.message: Job already submit in recent days, please check it.
errorCodes.description: Job already submit in recent days, please check it.

errorCodes.message: There can be only one running or failed task for the instance.
errorCodes.description: The current instance can only have one running/failed task at the same time.

errorCodes.message: OSS is forbidden to access. Please check your OSS bucket.
